00017 package WeBWorK::DB::Utils;
00018 use base qw(Exporter);
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::DB::Utils - useful utilities for the database modules.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 
00029 our @EXPORT    = ();
00030 our @EXPORT_OK = qw(
00031     global2user
00032     user2global
00033     initializeUserProblem
00034     make_vsetID
00035     make_vsetID_sql
00036     grok_vsetID
00037     grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql
00038     grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql
00039 );
00040 
00041 sub global2user($$) {
00042     my ($userRecordClass, $GlobalRecord) = @_;
00043     my $UserRecord = $userRecordClass->new();
00044     foreach my $field ($GlobalRecord->FIELDS()) {
00045         $UserRecord->$field($GlobalRecord->$field());
00046     }
00047     return $UserRecord;
00048 }
00049 
00050 sub user2global($$) {
00051     my ($globalRecordClass, $UserRecord) = @_;
00052     my $GlobalRecord = $globalRecordClass->new();
00053     foreach my $field ($GlobalRecord->FIELDS()) {
00054         $GlobalRecord->$field($UserRecord->$field());
00055     }
00056     return $GlobalRecord;
00057 }
00058 
00059 # Populate a user record with sane defaults and a random seed
00060 # This function edits the record in place, so you can discard
00061 # the return value.
00062 sub initializeUserProblem {
00063     my ($userProblem, $seed) = @_;
00064     $seed = int rand 5000 unless defined $seed;
00065     $userProblem->status(0.0);
00066     $userProblem->attempted(0);
00067     $userProblem->num_correct(0);
00068     $userProblem->num_incorrect(0);
00069     $userProblem->problem_seed($seed);
00070     $userProblem->sub_status(0.0);
00071 
00072     return $userProblem;
00073 }
00074 
00075 ################################################################################
00076 # versioning utilities
00077 ################################################################################
00078 
00079 sub make_vsetID($$) {
00080     my ($setID, $versionID) = @_;
00081     return "$setID,v$versionID";
00082 }
00083 
00084 # does not quote $setID and $versionID, because they could be strings, qualified
00085 # or unqualified field names, or complex expression
00086 sub make_vsetID_sql {
00087     my ($setID, $versionID) = @_;
00088     return "CONCAT($setID,',v',$versionID)";
00089 }
00090 
00091 sub grok_vsetID($) {
00092     my ($vsetID) = @_;
00093     my ($setID, $versionID) = $vsetID =~ /([^,]+)(?:,v(.*))?/;
00094     return $setID, $versionID;
00095 }
00096 
00097 # does not quote $field, because it could be a string, a qualified or
00098 # unqualified field name, or a complex expression
00099 sub grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql($) {
00100     my ($field) = @_;
00101     return "SUBSTRING($field,1,INSTR($field,',v')-1)";
00102 }
00103 
00104 # does not quote $field, because it could be a string, a qualified or
00105 # unqualified field name, or a complex expression
00106 sub grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql($) {
00107     my ($field) = @_;
00108     # the "+0" casts the resulting value as a number
00109     return "(SUBSTRING($field,INSTR($field,',v')+2)+0)";
00110 }
00111
